title:
Investigating two-loop effects for first-order electroweak phase
  transitions
authors: Lauri Niemi and Tuomas V.I. Tenkanen
abstract:
We study first-order electroweak phase transitions in the real-singlet
extended Standard Model, for which non-zero mixing between the Higgs and the
singlet can efficiently strengthen the transitions. We perform large-scale
parameter space scans of the model using two-loop effective potential at
next-to-next-to leading order in the high-temperature expansion, greatly
improving description of phase transition thermodynamics over existing one-loop
studies. We find that 1) two-loop corrections to the effective potential lead
to narrower regions of strong first-order transitions and significantly smaller
critical temperatures, 2) transitions involving a discontinuity in the singlet
expectation value are significantly stronger at two-loop order, 3)
high-temperature expansion is accurate for a wide range of parameter space that
allows strong transitions, although it is less reliable for the very strongest
transitions. These findings suggest revisiting past studies that connect the
possibility of a first-order electroweak phase transition with future collider
phenomenology.
